page.title: 19 Ringsfield Church.
page.content: Ringsfield is a small village to the SW of Beccles.The church roof is thatched and the tower square with flint walls.Over the porch is a sun- dial and the metal doors beneath show a robin on its nest.On the new lectern and kneelers are more robins to commemorate a robin who nested in the old lectern.All the pew ends are carved as is the pulpit. Many of the windows are beautiful stained glass.The bells were rehung in 1957 and there is one newer bell.There are carved marble angels on a tomb outside on a Princesses grave. Part of the churchyard is left rough as part of some work by the Nature Conservancy to encourage wildlife. The church and churchyard are in very good condition for such a tiny congregation. Well worth a visit.
